titleStmt.title: An order and declaration of His Highness the Lord Protector, with the advice of his Council for an assessment of threescore thousand pounds by the moneth, for six moneths, for and towards the maintenance of the armies and navies of this Commonwealth. Thursday February 8. 1654. Ordered by His Highness the Lord Protector, and his Council, that this order and declaration be forthwith printed and published. Henry Scobell, Clerk of the Council.
Orders in Council. 1654-02-08
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1653-1658 : O. Cromwell)

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: AN ORDER AND DECLARATION Of His HighneÅ¿s The Lord Protector, With the advice of his COUNCIL, FOR An AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sment Of threeÅ¿core thouÅ¿and pounds by the Moneth, for Å¿ix Moneths, for and towards the Maintenance of the Armies and Navies of this COMMONWEALTH.
ORdered by His HighneÅ¿s the Lord PROTECTOR, and His COUNCIL, That this Order and Declaration be forthwith Printed and PubliÅ¿hed.
Henry Scobell, Clerk of the Council.
London, Printed by Henry Hills and John Field, Printers to His HighneÅ¿s, MDCLIV.

div.head: AN ORDER AND DECLARATION Of His HighneÅ¿s the Lord Protector, with the advice of His Council, for An AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sment Of threeÅ¿core thouÅ¿and pounds by the Moneth, for Å¿ix Moneths, for and towards the maintenance of the Armies and Navies of this Commonwealth.
div.p:
WHereas in the Å¿even and twentieth Article of the Government of the Common-wealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland, it is expreÅ¿Å¿ed as followeth, That a ConÅ¿tant yearly Revenue Å¿hall be raiÅ¿ed, Å¿ettled and eÅ¿tabliÅ¿hed for maintaining ten
thouÅ¿and HorÅ¿e and Dragoons, and twenty thouÅ¿and Foot, in England, Scotland, and Ireland, for the Defence and Security thereof, and alÅ¿o for a convenient number of Ships, for guarding the Seas, beÅ¿ides two hundred thouÅ¿and pounds per annum, for defraying other neceÅ¿Å¿ary Charges for AdminiÅ¿tration of JuÅ¿tice, and other Expences of the Government; which Revenue Å¿hall be raiÅ¿ed by the CuÅ¿toms, and Å¿uch other waies and means as Å¿hall be agreed upon by the Lord Protector and Council, and Å¿hall not be taken away or diminiÅ¿hed, nor the way agreed upon for raiÅ¿ing the Å¿ame, altered, but by conÅ¿ent of the Lord Protector and the Parliament. And wheras in purÅ¿uance of the Å¿aid Å¿even and twentieth Article of the Government, upon ConÅ¿ideration had by His HighneÅ¿s the Lord Protector and his Council, how the Å¿aid Revenue might be raiÅ¿ed with greateÅ¿t eaÅ¿e to the people, It was Agreed upon and Declared by His HighneÅ¿s and His Council, That the Å¿ame Å¿hould be raiÅ¿ed (among other things) by the CuÅ¿tomes and SubÅ¿idies upon Goods and Merchandizes, and by the Duty of ExciÅ¿e and New ImpoÅ¿t, and by a Tax of eighty thouÅ¿and pounds per menÅ¿em, to be raiÅ¿ed in England, Scotland, and Ireland, from and after the five and twentieth day of December One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred fifty and four, whereof the proportion to be raiÅ¿ed in England is alÅ¿o agreed by His HighneÅ¿s and His Council, not to exceed the Å¿um of threeÅ¿core thouÅ¿and pounds by the Moneth, to be aÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ed, taxed, levied, collected and paid, (Å¿aving as is hereafter expreÅ¿Å¿ed) in Å¿uch manner, and by Å¿uch waies and means as the Å¿um of one hundred and twenty thouÅ¿and pounds
by the Moneth, by an Act of Parliament, Entituled, An Act for an AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sment, at the rate of one hundred and twenty thouÅ¿and pounds by the Moneth, for Å¿ix Moneths, from the twenty fifth day of December, One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred and fifty three, to the four and twentieth day of June, then next enÅ¿uing, towards the maintenance of the Armies and Navies of this Common-wealth, was appointed to be Taxed, AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ed, Levied, Collected, and Paid, and according to the Å¿everal Rates and Proportions of the Moyety of the ReÅ¿pective Summes by the Å¿aid Act Å¿et upon the ReÅ¿pective Counties, Cities and Places therein mentioned, That is to Å¿ay,
UPon the County of Bedford, the Å¿um of eight hundred pounds.
The County of Berks, the Å¿um of nine hundred thirty three pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The City and County of the City of BriÅ¿tol, the Å¿umme of one hundred fourty Å¿ix pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The County of Buckingham, the Å¿um of one thouÅ¿and one hundred pounds.
The County of Cambridge, the Å¿umme of nine hundred and fourty five pounds.
The IÅ¿le of Ely, the Å¿umme of three hundred and fifteen pounds.
The County of CheÅ¿ter, the Å¿um of Å¿ix hundred and Å¿ixty pounds.
The City and County of the City of CheÅ¿ter, the Å¿umme of Å¿eventy three pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Cornwal, the Å¿umme of
one thouÅ¿and four hundred pounds.
The County of Cumberland, the Å¿umme of ninety two pounds eleven Å¿hillings and four pence.
The County of Derby, the Å¿umme of eight hundred pounds.
The County of Devon, the Å¿umme of two thouÅ¿and five hundred Å¿eventy four pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The City and County of the City of Exon, the Å¿um of ninety two pounds.
The County of DorÅ¿et, the Å¿um of eleven hundred twenty four pounds three Å¿hillings and four pence.
The Town and County of Pool, the Å¿umme of nine pounds three Å¿hillings and four pence.
The County of Durham, the Å¿umm of one hundred thirty one pounds fifteen Å¿hillings one penny farthing.
The County of York, with the City and County of the City of York, the Å¿umm of two thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred and eight pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The Town and County of KingÅ¿ton upon Hull, the Summe of fifty and eight pounds.
The County of EÅ¿Å¿ex, the Å¿umm of three thouÅ¿and pounds.
The County of GlouceÅ¿ter, the Summ of one thouÅ¿and three hundred ninety four pounds.
The City and County of the City of GlouceÅ¿ter, the Å¿umme of one hundred thirty nine pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Hereford, the Å¿umm of one thouÅ¿and pounds.
The County of Hertford, the Å¿umm of one thouÅ¿and two hundred pounds.
The County of Huntingdon, the Å¿um of five hundred thirty three pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Kent, with the City and County of the City of Canterbury, the Å¿umme of three thouÅ¿and one hundred thirty three pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings eight pence.
The County of LancaÅ¿ter, the Å¿um of eight hundred pounds.
The County of LeiceÅ¿ter, the Å¿um of nine hundred thirty three pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Lincoln, with the City and County of the City of Lincoln, the Summe of two thouÅ¿and three hundred thirty three pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The City of London, the Å¿um of four thouÅ¿and pounds.
The County of MiddleÅ¿ex, with the City and Liberty of WeÅ¿tminÅ¿ter, the Å¿um of one thouÅ¿and five hundred thirty three pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings eight pence.
The County of Monmouth, the Å¿um of four hundred pounds.
The County of Northampton, the Summe of one thouÅ¿and two hundred pounds.
The County of Nottingham, the Å¿umm of Å¿even hundred Å¿eventy four pounds four Å¿hillings.
The Town and County of the Town of Nottingham, the Å¿um of twenty five pounds Å¿ixteen Å¿hillings.
The County of Norfolk, the Å¿umme of three thouÅ¿and one hundred and Å¿ix pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The City and County of the City of Norwich, the Å¿um of one hundred and Å¿ixty pounds.
The County of Northumberland, the Summe of one hundred fifty four pounds five Å¿hillings Å¿ix pence three farthings.
The Town of NewcaÅ¿tle, the Å¿um of thirty pounds and ten Å¿hillings.
The County of Oxon, the Summe of nine hundred Å¿ixty Å¿ix pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The County of Rutland, the Å¿umm of two hundred thirty three pounds, Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Salop, the Sum of one thouÅ¿and one hundred thirty three pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Stafford, the Å¿um of Å¿even hundred eighty eight pounds.
The City and County of the City of Litchfield, the Å¿um of twelve pounds.
The County of SomerÅ¿et, the Sum of Two thouÅ¿and three hundred thirty three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Southampton, with the Town and County of Southampton, the Sum of One thouÅ¿and Å¿even hundred thirty three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Suffolk, the Sum of Three thouÅ¿and one hundred thirty three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Surrey, the Sum of One thouÅ¿and three hundred forty one Pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The Borough of Southwark, the Sum of One hundred fifty eight Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings eight pence.
The County of SuÅ¿Å¿ex, the Sum of One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred thirty three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Warwick, with the City and County of the City of Coventry, the Sum of One thouÅ¿and Å¿ixty Å¿ix Pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The County of WorceÅ¿ter, the Sum of One thouÅ¿and and thirteen Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The City and County of the City of WorceÅ¿ter, the Sum of Fifty three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Wilts, the Sum of One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred Å¿ixty Å¿ix Pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The County of WeÅ¿tmerland, the Sum of Sixty three Pounds eight Å¿hillings.
The IÅ¿le of AngleÅ¿ey, the Sum of One hundred and Å¿ixteen Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Brecknock, the Sum of Three hundred and ten Pounds.
The County of Cardigan, the Sum of Three hundred Å¿ixty Å¿ix Pounds.
The County of Carmarthen, the Sum of Three hundred and two Pounds.
The County of Carnarvan, the Sum of One hundred Å¿eventy three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Denbigh, the Sum of Two hundred thirty three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Flint, the Sum of One hundred and Å¿ixteen Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Glamorgan, the Sum of Three hundred ninety and three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Merioneth, the Sum of One hundred and Å¿ix Pounds thirteen Å¿hillings and four pence.
The County of Montgomery, the Sum of Two hundred fifty three Pounds Å¿ix Å¿hillings and eight pence.
The County of Pembroke, the Sum of Three hundred forty eight Pounds.
The County of Radnor, the Sum of Two hundred and eighteen Pounds.
The Town of Haverford-WeÅ¿t, the Sum of Twelve Pounds and ten Å¿hillings.
The Town of Berwick, the Sum of Five Pounds.

By which Agreement and Declaration of His HighneÅ¿s and His Council, It is Provided, That in caÅ¿e the Moneys ariÅ¿ing
by the CuÅ¿toms and other the Revenues therein mentioned, Å¿hould be improved and amount to a greater Yearly value then they were at the time of making the Å¿aid Agreement, or any other Revenue or Moneys Å¿hall be added or accrew to the VÅ¿e of the Commonwealth, in Å¿uch CaÅ¿e there Å¿hall be a proportionable Abatement of the Å¿aid Monethly AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment; His HighneÅ¿s the Lord Protector and His Council, in purÅ¿uance of the Å¿aid twenty Å¿eventh Article of the Government, and of the Å¿aid Agreement and Declaration aforeÅ¿aid, and for preventing the Burthen and Evils attending Free-quarter, which muÅ¿t otherwiÅ¿e unavoidably fall upon this Nation, Do Declare and Order, That the Å¿aid Sum of ThreeÅ¿core thouÅ¿and Pounds by the Moneth for Six Moneths, commencing from the Å¿aid Five and twentieth day of December One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred fifty four, and ending the Four and twentieth day of June One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred fifty five, Shall be Taxed, AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ed, Levied, Collected and Paid in the Å¿everal Counties and Places, in Å¿uch maner, and by Å¿uch ways and means, and according to the Å¿everal Rates and Proportions before hereby Å¿et down and expreÅ¿Å¿ed; And do Order and Require the Å¿everal CommiÅ¿sioners and other PerÅ¿ons nominated and mentioned in the before-mentioned Act, and Å¿uch others, as by any Order of that Parliament, or of His HighneÅ¿s the Lord Protector and His Council, have been Å¿ince added as CommiÅ¿Å¿ioners, or Å¿o many of them as by the Å¿aid
Act are thereunto reÅ¿pectively authorized, to VÅ¿e, ExerciÅ¿e and put in Execution all and every the Powers and Authorities for the AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sing, Levying, Collecting and Paying the preÅ¿ent Six Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment hereby appointed; as alÅ¿o the Arrears of all former AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ments, which they had or were impowered to VÅ¿e and ExerciÅ¿e by the Å¿aid recited Act, for the AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sing, Collecting, Levying and Payment of the aforeÅ¿aid Six Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment of One hundred and twenty thouÅ¿and Pounds by the Moneth: And for the better effecting thereof, the Å¿everal and reÅ¿pective CommiÅ¿sioners for the Å¿aid reÅ¿pective Counties, Cities and Towns, Å¿hall meet together at the moÅ¿t common and uÅ¿ual place of Meeting, in each of the Å¿aid Counties, Cities and Towns reÅ¿pectively, on or before the Twentieth day of February, One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred fifty four; And the Å¿aid CommiÅ¿sioners, or Å¿o many of them as Å¿hall then and there attend and be preÅ¿ent, Å¿hall put this preÅ¿ent Order in execution, for the Directing, Managing, Levying and Bringing in the Å¿aid Monethly AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment hereby required; and Å¿hall then, if they Å¿ee cauÅ¿e, appoint a Å¿econd General Meeting on or before the FirÅ¿t day of March then next following, to the end the Rules and Directions aforeÅ¿aid may be as is before declared, timely proÅ¿ecuted and obÅ¿erved, Å¿o as the full Sum of the firÅ¿t Three Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment, charged upon each DiviÅ¿ion, Hundred, PariÅ¿h and Place, may be at once wholly Collected and Paid in to the reÅ¿pective Receivers-General at or before the Twentieth day of March, One
thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred fifty four, and the latter Three Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment to be alÅ¿o fully Collected and Paid in to the reÅ¿pective Receivers-General, at or before the Twentieth day of May then next following. And it is further Ordered, That in caÅ¿e the way and maner of AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sing by a Survey and Poundrate, in Å¿uch Å¿ort as is preÅ¿cribed by the Å¿aid recited Act, Å¿hall prove prejudicial and obÅ¿tructive to the Bringing in of the Six Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment aforeÅ¿aid, by the times limited for paying in of the Å¿ame; That then, and in all Å¿uch caÅ¿es, the Å¿aid CommiÅ¿sioners in any of the Å¿aid Counties, Cities, Towns and Places in the Å¿aid Act mentioned, where Å¿uch ObÅ¿tructions Å¿hall be or happen, or the major part of them preÅ¿ent at their General-Meeting, may, and are hereby Authorized for the Removal of Å¿uch ObÅ¿tructions, to proceed according to the moÅ¿t juÅ¿t and equal way of Rates held in Å¿uch places, in the Proportioning, Levying and AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sing the reÅ¿pective Sums charged upon them and every of them, according to the Directions of an Ordinance of the Eighth of June, One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred fifty four, for an AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sment for Six Moneths thereby appointed: And the Å¿everal and reÅ¿pective CommiÅ¿sioners, Receivers-General, Collectors, Sub-Collectors, and all other perÅ¿ons, who are or Å¿hall be IntruÅ¿ted or Imployed in the AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿sing, Levying, Collecting or Receiving of the Å¿aid Six Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ments, or any part thereof, are hereby enjoyned and required to obÅ¿erve Å¿uch Orders and Directions as Å¿hall from time to time be made and given forth by the CommiÅ¿Å¿ioners
for the TreaÅ¿ury, or by the Committee or CommiÅ¿sioners for the Army, or any three of them, in and concerning the premiÅ¿es. Provided always, and it is hereby Ordered, That in Å¿tead of the TreaÅ¿urers at Wars mentioned in the Å¿aid Act, the Receivers-General for this whole Six Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment, Å¿hall be, and are hereby authorized and impowered to Receive from the Receivers-General of the reÅ¿pective Counties, Cities and Places, and every of them, All and every the Sums of Money hereby to be Taxed, AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ed, Levyed, Collected and Paid for the Å¿aid Six Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment, or otherwiÅ¿e as aforeÅ¿aid; and to give Acquittances and DiÅ¿charges, and to make Å¿uch Alowances in and about the premiÅ¿es, in as full and ample maner to all intents and purpoÅ¿es, as the TreaÅ¿urers at War (mentioned in the Å¿aid Act) by the Å¿aid Act, or by one Ordinance of the Nine and twentieth day of June, One thouÅ¿and Å¿ix hundred fifty four, Entituled, An Ordinance for Continuing a Committee for the Army, and TreaÅ¿urers at War, were impowered and enabled to do: And the Å¿aid Receivers-General of the reÅ¿pective Counties, Cities and Places, and every of them, are hereby Authorized and Required to make Payment of the Å¿aid Å¿everal Sums which Å¿hall be by them received of all and every Collector and Sub-Collector by vertue hereof, unto John Blackwel the yonger, and Richard Dean, EÅ¿quires, Receivers-General for this whole Six Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment, at Guild-Hall London, to be by them paid in to, and accompted for in the Receipt of His HighneÅ¿s Exchequer; and that all and every
the Acquittance and Acquittances of the Å¿aid Receivers-General for this whole Six Moneths AÅ¿Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ment, Å¿hall be unto the Å¿aid Receivers-General for the Å¿aid reÅ¿pective Counties, Cities and Places, and to all other perÅ¿ons who Å¿hall by vertue hereof pay any Moneys unto them for the purpoÅ¿es aforeÅ¿aid, a Å¿ufficient DiÅ¿charge.
ORdered by His HighneÅ¿s the Lord Protector and the Council, That this Order and Declaration be forthwith printed and publiÅ¿hed.

closer.signed: Hen: Scobell, Clerk of the Council.
